gw.webservice.ab.ab800.abcontactapi

Class ABContactAPI

  • gw.webservice.ab.ab800.abcontactapi.ABContactAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    public class ABContactAPI
implements _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

        IntrinsicType

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ABContactAPI()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AddressBookUIDContainer createContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
      Create a new contact. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. A new ABContact (of subtype as specified by abContactXML) is created. Then, ContactIntegrationMapper.populateABContactFromXML is called to populate local entities from abContactXML The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
      AddressBookUIDContainer createContactPendingApproval(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML, ABContactAPIPendingContactChange updateContext)
      Submit a new contact for creation that potentially requires approval. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. A new ABContact (of subtype as specified by abContactXML) is created. Then, ContactMapper.populateABContactFromXML is called to populate local entities from abContactXML. The status of the contact is set to APPROVAL_NEEDED. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
      ABContactAPIFindDuplicatesResultContainer findDuplicates(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML, ABContactAPISearchSpec abContactAPISearchSpec)
      Finds contacts that match the specified contact.
      String getReplacementAddress(String addressLinkID)
      Get the linkID of the address that replaces the address denoted by the argument because the latter has been merged into the former.
      String getReplacementContact(String contactLinkID)
      Returns the linkID of the contact that replaced the contact denoted by the argument. This happens as a result of a contact merge in the UI or by calling ABContact.replaceWith(ABContact). Returns null if the contact has not been replaced by another contact.
      ABContactAPISpecialistService[] getSpecialistServices(String contactLinkID)
      boolean removeContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
      Removes the contact with the matching link ID if the contact is not being used by any remote application. If a remote application is not running when this method runs, then the contact is assumed to be in use and is not removed. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
      XmlBackedInstance retrieveContact(String linkID)
      Retrieve information about the contact uniquely specified by the linkID
      RelatedContactInfoContainer retrieveRelatedContacts(String linkID, ContactBidiRel[] relationshipTypes)
      Retrieve information about the contact's related contacts
      ABContactAPISearchResultContainer searchContact(ABContactAPISearchCriteria abContactAPISearchCriteria, ABContactAPISearchSpec abContactAPISearchSpec)
      Searches for all contacts that match the given search criteria.
      AddressBookUIDContainer updateContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
      Update an existing contact. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. First, a preexisting ABContact is selected based on abContactXML.LinkID. If none is found, then a BadIdentifierException is thrown. Then, origValue attributes for all fields and fks being updated are checked against those same values in the local version, and if any discrepancies are found, then an EntityStateException is thrown. In this way, ContactManager manages the versioning of contact-related changes across multiple client applications. If no exceptions have yet been thrown, then ContactIntegrationMapper.populateABContactFromXML is called to populate local entities from abContactXML. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
      void updateContactPendingApproval(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML, ABContactAPIPendingContactChange updateContext)
      Submit an update to an existing contact which requires approval before being applied. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. The updateContext contains the application context for the change from the client application. A preexisting ABContact is selected based on abContactXML.LinkID. If none is found, then a BadIdentifierException is thrown. A PendingContactUpdate entity is created for that Contact with the update XML and the context in this call. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
      ABContactAPIValidateCreateContactResult validateCreateContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
      Invokes ValidateABContactCreationPlugin.validateCanCreate() to see if abContactXML has the minimum data required to create an ABContact.

      • Methods inherited from class _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

        equals, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

        ABContactAPI()

    • Method Detail

      • updateContact

        AddressBookUIDContainer updateContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
        Update an existing contact. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. First, a preexisting ABContact is selected based on abContactXML.LinkID. If none is found, then a BadIdentifierException is thrown. Then, origValue attributes for all fields and fks being updated are checked against those same values in the local version, and if any discrepancies are found, then an EntityStateException is thrown. In this way, ContactManager manages the versioning of contact-related changes across multiple client applications. If no exceptions have yet been thrown, then ContactIntegrationMapper.populateABContactFromXML is called to populate local entities from abContactXML. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
        Parameters:
        abContactXML - the contact information in XmlBackedInstance format
        Returns:
        An AddressBookUIDContainer containing IDs for the Contact and child objects

      • createContact

        AddressBookUIDContainer createContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
        Create a new contact. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. A new ABContact (of subtype as specified by abContactXML) is created. Then, ContactIntegrationMapper.populateABContactFromXML is called to populate local entities from abContactXML The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
        Parameters:
        abContactXML - the contact information in XmlBackedInstance format
        Returns:
        An AddressBookUIDContainer containing IDs for the Contact and child objects

      • validateCreateContact

        ABContactAPIValidateCreateContactResult validateCreateContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
        Invokes ValidateABContactCreationPlugin.validateCanCreate() to see if abContactXML has the minimum data required to create an ABContact.
        Parameters:
        abContactXML - XmlBackedInstance representing an ABContact
        Returns:
        An ABContactAPIValidateCreateContactResult indicating whether validation passed and, in if validation failed, an error message.

      • updateContactPendingApproval

        void updateContactPendingApproval(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML,
                                ABContactAPIPendingContactChange updateContext)
        Submit an update to an existing contact which requires approval before being applied. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. The updateContext contains the application context for the change from the client application. A preexisting ABContact is selected based on abContactXML.LinkID. If none is found, then a BadIdentifierException is thrown. A PendingContactUpdate entity is created for that Contact with the update XML and the context in this call. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
        Parameters:
        abContactXML - the contact information in XmlBackedInstance format
        updateContext - the application context for this update

      • createContactPendingApproval

        AddressBookUIDContainer createContactPendingApproval(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML,
                                                   ABContactAPIPendingContactChange updateContext)
        Submit a new contact for creation that potentially requires approval. Contact information is expected to be in XmlBackedInstance format. A new ABContact (of subtype as specified by abContactXML) is created. Then, ContactMapper.populateABContactFromXML is called to populate local entities from abContactXML. The status of the contact is set to APPROVAL_NEEDED. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
        Parameters:
        abContactXML - the contact information in XmlBackedInstance format
        updateContext - the context information about this create request
        Returns:
        An AddressBookUIDContainer containing IDs for the Contact and child objects

      • removeContact

        boolean removeContact(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML)
        Removes the contact with the matching link ID if the contact is not being used by any remote application. If a remote application is not running when this method runs, then the contact is assumed to be in use and is not removed. The caller must set the transaction id in the soap request headers. This can be done using ContactAPIUtil.setTransactionId().
        Parameters:
        abContactXML - XmlBackedInstance that contains the linkID of the contact to be removed and miscellaneous information
        Returns:
        whether the contact was successfully removed

      • searchContact

        ABContactAPISearchResultContainer searchContact(ABContactAPISearchCriteria abContactAPISearchCriteria,
                                              ABContactAPISearchSpec abContactAPISearchSpec)
        Searches for all contacts that match the given search criteria.
        Parameters:
        abContactAPISearchCriteria - the criteria for the search. This may not be null.
        abContactAPISearchSpec - specifications for how the results should be returned
        Returns:
        ABContactAPISearchResultContainer contains search results

      • findDuplicates

        ABContactAPIFindDuplicatesResultContainer findDuplicates(XmlBackedInstance abContactXML,
                                                       ABContactAPISearchSpec abContactAPISearchSpec)
        Finds contacts that match the specified contact.
        Parameters:
        abContactXML - the XmlBackedInstance for the contact for which to find matches
        abContactAPISearchSpec - specifications for how the results should be returned
        Returns:
        ABContactAPIFindDuplicatesResultContainer contains summary information about each match

      • retrieveContact

        XmlBackedInstance retrieveContact(String linkID)
        Retrieve information about the contact uniquely specified by the linkID
        Parameters:
        linkID -
        Returns:
        the contact information in XmlBackedInstance format

      • retrieveRelatedContacts

        RelatedContactInfoContainer retrieveRelatedContacts(String linkID,
                                                  ContactBidiRel[] relationshipTypes)
        Retrieve information about the contact's related contacts
        Parameters:
        linkID - specifies the contact
        relationshipTypes - relationship type of the related contacts to return information on. If null, then no restriction is enforced on the related contacts returned.
        Returns:
        information about the contact's related contacts

      • getReplacementAddress

        String getReplacementAddress(String addressLinkID)
        Get the linkID of the address that replaces the address denoted by the argument because the latter has been merged into the former.
        Parameters:
        addressLinkID - linkID of an address
        Returns:
        linkID of the address that replaces the address denoted by the argument

      • getReplacementContact

        String getReplacementContact(String contactLinkID)
        Returns the linkID of the contact that replaced the contact denoted by the argument. This happens as a result of a contact merge in the UI or by calling ABContact.replaceWith(ABContact). Returns null if the contact has not been replaced by another contact.
        Parameters:
        contactLinkID - linkID of an ABContact
        Returns:
        linkID of the ABContact that replaced the ABContact denoted by the argument

      • getSpecialistServices

        ABContactAPISpecialistService[] getSpecialistServices(String contactLinkID)
        Parameters:
        contactLinkID -
        Returns:
        The SpecialistServices for the ABContact with the given LinkID.
